page.title: 13FARMING
page.content: Over 80% of the Survey Area is farm land in the Green Belt.The North East is Grade 2 land but much of the area has poor soils.There are patches of damaged farmland used for refuse disposal,of threatened landscape with caravan parks,stables and piggeries, and of other farmland near Pilgrims Hatch which has been abandoned perhaps for planning gain.The main crop is barley with a great increase in the area under rape.Market gardening and garden centres are expanding.Sheep, beef cattle and dairy cattle are kept. Canterbury Tye farm has been split by the Brentwood by_pass.South East of the by_pass,the farmland is owned by Courage Brewery while the other part is owned by a Mountnessing farmer.The farm house and barns dated 1650 are occupied by a shopowner who does not farm the few fields he owns.
